hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Hisham ibn Abd al-Malik Abu al-Walid al-Tayalisi from Shu'bah, Amr said: He informed me, he said: I heard Abdullah ibn Abi Awfa, and he was from the Companions of the Tree. Muhammad ibn Umar said: Abdullah ibn Abi Awfa remained in Madinah until the Prophet ﷺ was taken (died), then he moved to Kufa and settled there where the Muslims settled, and built a house for himself in (the quarter of) Aslam. His eyesight went (he became blind). He died in Kufa in the year eighty-six

hadiths.english_translation: One from Banu Tha'l, with kunya Abu Tarif, he settled in Kufa and built a house there in the quarters of Ta'y. He remained with Ali ibn Abi Talib, may Allah be pleased with him, and witnessed with him the battles of Jamal and Siffin. His eye was lost on the day of Jamal. He died in Kufa during the time of al-Mukhtar in the year sixty-eight

hadiths.english_translation: His kunya is Abu Amr. He accepted Islam in the year the Prophet ﷺ died. The Messenger of Allah ﷺ sent him to destroy Dhul-Khalasah (an idol). After that he settled in Kufa and built a house there in the quarters of Bajilah. He died in al-Sarah during the governorship of al-Dahhak ibn Qays over Kufa. Al-Dahhak's governorship lasted two and a half years after Ziyad ibn Abi Sufyan

hadiths.english_translation: One from Banu al-Harith ibn Mu'awiyah, with kunya Abu Muhammad. He came as a delegation to the Prophet ﷺ, then returned to Yemen. When the Prophet ﷺ was taken (died), he apostatized. Ziyad ibn Labi al-Bayadi besieged him at al-Najir until he came down to him, so he captured him and sent him to Abu Bakr al-Siddiq. Abu Bakr pardoned him and married him to his sister. When the people went to Iraq, he went with them, settled in Kufa, and built a house there in the quarters of Kinda. He died there, while Al-Hasan ibn Ali ibn Abi Talib was in Kufa at the time he made peace with Mu'awiyah. Al-Hasan prayed over him
